topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 1.1: Networking Operation (Neutron): High Availability

body.p: High Availability for OpenStack cloud networking has dependencies on Nova, Cinder, and Swift. You need to work with the system administrators responsible for these services. For an overview of High Availablity in the Helion OpenStack environment, see HP Helion OpenStack 1.1.1: High Availability (HA).

section.title: Completion of Helion OpenStack Neutron Prerequisite
section.p: Once Helion OpenStack Neutron networking prerequisite tasks have been completed, Helion OpenStack is ready to be installed. Once installed, the Network Administrator can configure the cloud network to support the OpenStack networking. These configuration requirements, options, and dependencies are discussed in Post Installation Tasks.
section.title: More information

li.p: [OpenStack Cloud Administrator Guide] (unable to find the link) [[xref to openstack url.]]

section.p: Note: All the tasks listed in this section depend on networking prerequisite tasks having been correctly completed. Configuring Helion OpenStack networking is not complicated but it requires that steps be completed exactly as shown. If you have questions about alternate steps, please contact HP Helion Customer Support:
